aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.definition:
Infrastructure for Spatial Information in Europe.  established by Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 March 2007. INSPIRE aims at making available relevant, harmonised and quality geographic information to support formulation, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of policies and activities which have a direct or indirect impact on the environment. 
Source: EC INSPIRE Geoportal http://www.inspire-geoportal.eu/index.cfm
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.name: INSPIRE

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: Network of the Heads of Environment Protection Agencies
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: EPA Network

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#h.definition: Helsinki Commission - Baltic Marine  Environment Protection Commission
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#h.name: HELCOM

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.definition:
Assessment that identifies and evaluates measures that reduce human contributions or vulnerabilities to environmental changes. It can focus on potential future response options and evaluate their risks and likely outcomes, or they may evaluate the effectiveness of policies and measures already adopted.
Source: Marine AoA.
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.name: Response assessment

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition:
Assessments that typically describe the present and changing status of ecosystems.
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: Status and trend (or process) assessment

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.definition: Assessments that identify and characterize the impacts of human activities and/or natural pressures on ecosystems and society. Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.name: Impact assessments

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.definition: Assessments that identify and evaluate measures that reduce human contributions or vulnerabilities to environmental changes. They can focus on potential future response options and evaluate their risks and likely outcomes, or they may evaluate the effectiveness of policies and measures already adopted. Source: Marine AoA.
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.name: Response assessments

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.definition: Assessment that integrates across environmental, economic and social aspects, across industry sectors, and across ecosystem components (which may include land-based sources of inputs as well as land-based industries that depend on marine resources). Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.name: Integrated assessment

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: European Marine  Observation and Data Network
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: EMODNET

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.definition:
It denotes the ability of an assessment to address the particular concerns of those using it. It is also referred to as ‘salience’. An assessment is relevant if the user is aware of it and it informs his/her decisions or behaviour.
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.name: Relevance

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.definition: Directorate General for Health and Consumer  Protection of the European Commission
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.name: DG SANCO

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.definition: Assessment that identifies and characterizes the impacts of human activities and/or natural pressures on ecosystems and society. Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.name: Impact assessment

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#t.definition:
Assessment that focuses on a theme or issue other than a single sector of human activity.
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#t.name: Thematic assessment

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition: Assessment that addresses a particular sector of human activity. Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: Sectoral assessment

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.definition: Coordination of Information on the  Environment
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.name: CORINE

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: European observation network for territorial  development
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: ESPON2013

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.definition: Inter-Organization Programme for the Sound Management of  Chemicals
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.name: IOMC

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#l.definition: EU Financial Instrument for the Environment
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#l.name: LIFE

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#p.definition: PRospectiveEnvironmental analysis of Land Use Development inEurope
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#p.name: PRELUDE

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.definition: Directors' meeting for environmental statistics and accounts
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.name: DIMESA

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.definition: Directorate General for Environment of the  European Commission
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.name: DG ENV

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.definition:
It is concerned with whether the knowledge assembled in the assessment is believed to be valid. An assessment gains credibility and authority by virtue of its information, methods and procedures.
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.name: Credibility

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#o.definition: Convention for the Protection of the Marine Environment of theNorth-East Atlantic
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#o.name: OSPAR

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#g.definition: Global Earth Observation System of Systems
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#g.name: GEOSS

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#o.definition: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#o.name: OECD

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.definition: Eionet’s infrastructure for supporting and improving data and information flows. Reportnet is based on a set of inter-related tools and processes which all build on the active use of the World Wide Web.
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.name: Reportnet

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: Network of Heads  of European Nature Conservation Agencies
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: ENCA Network

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition: The European Environment - State and outlook
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: SOER

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.definition: Children's Environment and Health Action Plan forEurope
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.name: CEHAPE

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#u.definition: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#u.name: UNFCCC

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition:
An ecosystem is a dynamic complex of plant, animal, and micro-organism communities and the non-living environment interacting as a functional unit.
Source: Millennium Ecosystem Assessment, 2005
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: Ecosystems

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#p.definition:
It includes both the expert reports/summaries/scenarios and underlying data and information used in the analyses. 
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#p.name: Product

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.definition: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild  Fauna and Flora
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#c.name: CITES

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#l.definition:
A measure of the acceptability or perceived fairness of an assessment. A legitimate assessment is one that has been conducted in a manner that allows users to be satisfied that their interests have been taken into account appropriately and that the process has been fair.
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#l.name: Legitimacy

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition: System of Environmental-Economic Accounting for Water
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: SEEAW

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#n.definition: National  Accounting Matrices including Environmental accounts
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#n.name: NAMEA

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: European Centre for Disease  Prevention and Control
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: ECDC

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#u.definition: United Nations Commission on Sustainable Development
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#u.name: UNCSD

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#a.definition: Formal efforts to assemble selected knowledge with a view toward making it publicly available in a form intended to be useful for decision-making (Mitchell and others 2006). By ‘formal’ the definition requires that the assessment should be sufficiently organised to identify components such as products, participants and issuing authority. ‘Selected knowledge’ indicates that the content has a defined scope or purpose and that not all information compiled and contributed is necessarily included in the report. The sources of knowledge may vary. While results from research and scientific knowledge predominate, assessments can supplement this with local, traditional or indigenous knowledge. Further, assessments can evaluate both existing information and research conducted expressly for the purpose. The definition also notes the importance of ensuring that assessments are in the public domain, as they may influence public debate and different types of decision-makers.
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#a.name: Assessment

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: European Topic Centre on Resource and Waste Management
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: ETC/RWM

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition: Assessments that address a particular sector of human activity. Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: Sectoral assessments

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#t.definition:
Assessments that focus on a theme or issue other than a single sector of human activity.
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#t.name: Thematic assessments

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#o.definition: Organisation for Security and Co-operation inEurope
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#o.name: OSCE

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition: Stern Review on the Economics of Climate Change
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: Stern report

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#a.definition: Formal efforts to assemble selected knowledge with a view toward making it publicly available in a form intended to be useful for decision-making (Mitchell and others 2006). By ‘formal’ the definition requires that the assessment should be sufficiently organised to identify components such as products, participants and issuing authority. ‘Selected knowledge’ indicates that the content has a defined scope or purpose and that not all information compiled and contributed is necessarily included in the report. The sources of knowledge may vary. While results from research and scientific knowledge predominate, assessments can supplement this with local, traditional or indigenous knowledge. Further, assessments can evaluate both existing information and research conducted expressly for the purpose. The definition also notes the importance of ensuring that assessments are in the public domain, as they may influence public debate and different types of decision-makers.
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#a.name: Assessments

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition: Strategic  Approach to International Chemicals Management
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: SAICM

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.definition: Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of  Chemicals
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#r.name: REACH

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: European Centre for Medium-Range  Weather Forecasts
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: ECMWF

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.definition: Strategic Impact Assessment (SIA), also known as Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA), is the assessment of the wider environmental, social and economic impacts of alternative proposals at the beginning of a project.
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#s.name: Strategic Impact Assessment (SIA)

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition:
An ecosystem is a dynamic complex of plant, animal, and micro-organism communities and the non-living environment interacting as a functional unit.
Source: Millennium Ecosystem Assessment, 2005
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: Ecosystem

Data about data.
Source: EEA glossary
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#m.name: Metadata

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#m.definition: pollution monitoring and assessment programme - Mediterranean  region
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#m.name: MED POL

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#p.definition:
Institutional arrangements established to govern, guide and conduct the assessment and to ensure that the mandate and procedures are followed.
Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#p.name: Process

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: European Topic Centre on Biological Diversity
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: ETC/BD

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: E-PRTR

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#g.name: GMES

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: Eurostat/ESTAT

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.definition: Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) is the term applied to the systematic examination of the likely impacts of development proposals on the environment prior to the beginning of any activity.
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA)

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.definition: Assessments that integrate across environmental, economic and social aspects, across industry sectors, and across ecosystem components (which may include land-based sources of inputs as well as land-based industries that depend on marine resources). Source: Marine AoA
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#i.name: Integrated assessments

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: EIONET

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#e.name: ETC/ACC

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#n.definition: Network to  enhance a European Environment Shared and Interoperable Information System
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#n.name: NESIS

aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.definition:
The causal framework for describing the interactions between society and the environment adopted by the European Environment Agency: driving forces, pressures, states, impacts, responses (extension of the PSR model developed by OECD).
Source: EEA glossary.
For more information download the DPSIR/Typology matrix
aoa.ew.eea.europa.eu_database_acronyms#d.name: DPSIR
